poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The herder had hardly got his ox to lumber along the path Till its shoulders surge as sea-swell, bristling auks and guillemots; So much for zen. He bobs along with the compass-orts for oars. Dick Tracy was drawn to look like John Wayne, not a razorbill; So much for comics. He stops his options and subscriptions. The world is control, psy-ops and samsara. He offs it. So much for that.
